distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: The data are available as a live data feature service hosted in ArcGIS Online. The dataset also may be downloaded in several different file formats from the NJGIN Open Data website.

distFormat.formatName: ArcGIS Online REST service; file geodatabase feature class, shapefile, KML

dataIdInfo.idPurp: The statewide layer of Election District boundaries was created as part of the New Jersey Election Security Initiative (2018 - 2023). The data are intended to supply online map display and query of accurate Election Day information. A dataset of Ward boundaries was included in the same data delivery.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset contains polygons representing Election District boundaries within all municipalities in the state of New Jersey. The statewide dataset was created from existing vector data maintained by Remington & Vernick Engineers under contract for eleven counties (in part or in whole,) and from county and municipal Election District and Ward maps, tax assessment parcel GIS data, and other data sources, for the balance of the state.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: NJ Department of State, Division of Elections KNOWiNK (Everyone Counts - Votem Corp.) Remington & Vernick Engineers created the GIS dataset. New Jersey county Boards of Elections and GIS staffs
dataIdInfo.suppInfo:
In New Jersey, each county Board of Elections is responsible for establishing Election Districts and Wards, publishing them, and reporting them to the NJ Department of State. Districting is governed by NJ Statute NJSA 19.
There are numerous Election District features in this release whose boundaries cross the existing Legislative District and Congressional District boundaries published by the NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS (NJOGIS.) A dataset that identifies these problem areas is available from NJOGIS.
For display mapping delivery to KNOWiNK, per the New Jersey statute, Title 19, the Election District polygons were designated red, and the number of each district was identified in red within its polygon. Ward polygons were designated orange, and the number of each ward was identified in orange within its polygon. The polygons were delivered as to KNOWiNK as JSON objects where GeoJSON data is a geospatial data interchange format based on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON).
Fields required to be carried during updates, for use by KNOWiNK in voter managment software, are: key, county_id, municipality_id, ward_id, district_id, county_name, municipal_name, county_code, municipal_code, ward_code, district_code, radius, centroid_lat, centroid_lng. Essential fields for GIS use were renamed into shapefile-friendly format for the publication data, and unnecessary fields were dropped.

Consts.useLimit:
The data are not survey data and must not be used as survey data. The geodetic accuracy and precision of the Geographic Information System (GIS) data has not been developed nor verified by a professional licensed land surveyor and shall not be nor is intended to be used in matters requiring delineation and location of true ground horizontal and/or vertical controls.

See the balance of this metadata record for conditions that limit appropriate uses. Users are urged to look at this documentation to assess the fitness of the data for any planned use.

Acknowledgement of the originator, NJ Department of State, Division of Elections; and publisher, NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS (NJOGIS), would be appreciated for maps, data or other products derived from these data.

The State of New Jersey makes great effort to provide secure, accurate, and complete data and metadata. However, portions of the data and metadata may be incorrect or not current. Any errors or omissions should be reported for investigation.

The State of New Jersey, its officers, employees or agents shall not be liable for damages or losses of any kind arising out of or in connection with the use or performance of data and metadata, including but not limited to, damages or losses caused by reliance upon the accuracy or timeliness of any such data and metadata, or damages incurred from the viewing, distributing, or copying of those materials.

The data and metadata are provided "as is." No warranty of any kind, implied, expressed, or statutory, including but not limited to the warranties of non-infringement of third party rights, title, merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and freedom from computer virus, is given with respect to the data and metadata, or its hyperlinks to other Internet resources.

The State disclaims any duty or obligation either to maintain availability of or to update the data and metadata.

prcStep.stepDesc:
Vector Election District boundaries were compiled from municipal and county source files maintained by Remington & Vernick Engineers.
Additional vector data were added from county and municipal sources, and created from other source information including county and municipal Election District maps and statewide tax parcel GIS data. Assistance with County source access was provided by KNOWiNK and the NJ Department of State, Division of Elections. See Conceptual Consistency Report (Data Quality) for specifics by county.
Additional GIS resource data and imagery data was provided by the New Jersey Geographic Information Network (NJGIN) : https://njgin.state.nj.us/NJ_NJGINExplorer/index.jsp.
Additional cadastral feature mapping data, such as, waterways, roadways, railroads, aerial orthophotography, etc. was obtained from the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection (NJDEP): https://www.state.nj.us/dep/gis/.
The digital election maps were created and maintained utilizing Autodesk's AutoCAD and Esri ArcGIS software applications. Mapping datasets were created in feet units and projected in the New Jersey State Plane Coordinate System, NAD 83.
Processor was assisted by Stephen Volpe and Nicholas Phelan of RVE.
Data, with required attribution, were delivered to KNOWiNK for analysis and subsequent use in their voter management system. Attribute fields required by KNOWiNK were: "County”; “Municipality”; “Ward”; “District”; “District Type”.

After review by KNOWiNK, corrections were made in Gloucester County with the help of county staff John Franchetti. Test cases were run to confirm corrections in several towns, specifically Franklin, Deptford, Matua, Pitman and Woodbury Heights. Corrections also were made in Hudson County, Jersey City Ward E, with the help of county staff Joseph Negron who sent KnowInk an updated map of Ward E displaying additional Districts 24 & 25. Both Districts were added to the data.
Feature class was updated with revised municipal boundaries from NJ Office of GIS.

Initial statewide data set with required attribution was delivered to KNOWiNK for QA analysis and subsequent use in their voter management system. Attribute fields required by KNOWiNK were: "County”; “Municipality”; “Ward”; “District”; “District Type”.
KNOWiNK reviewed the GIS data (multiple rounds), including running routines in MongoDB and JSON. Data were examined for duplicate data features and mismatches in the key codes.
Dataset, including expanded KNOWiNK-required attributes, was delivered back to RVE by KNOWiNK, and metadata were written for the feature class.

Feature class was revised for publication to eliminate un-needed fields, re-name and re-order fields. Field MCODE_1040 was added, to hold NJ-1040 municipal codes for the convenience of general GIS users. Data updates were delivered, with boundary corrections in Old Bridge, Middlesex County.

Metadata were substantially re-written to parse correctly into the Esri FGDC-style stylesheet, for publication, and were updated. Publication feature class was updated from RVE source data, and field MCODE_1040 was filled by field calculation from appropriate joins with municipal name and code reference table published by NJ Open Data.

stepProc.rpOrgName: NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS (NJOGIS)

report.measDesc:
Data for all counties within the state of New Jersey are current as of Temporal Extent (Time Period of Content) date, with the exception of Gloucester County. Gloucester County Election District boundaries are based on 2018-2019 data.
Remington & Vernick Engineers provided GIS data, maintained by them under contract to county governments, for these counties: Atlantic, Bergen, Camden, Essex, Mercer, Monmouth, Passaic, Union, Ocean, Somerset, Sussex. The following counties provided GIS files maintained by the county or its vendor: Burlington, Gloucester, Cape May, Morris, Hunterdon, Middlesex. The following counties provided paper or PDF maps: Cumberland, Salem, Warren The following county provided a combination of paper maps and GIS files: Hudson
There are numerous Election District features in this release whose boundaries cross the existing Legislative District and Congressional District boundaries published by the NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS (NJOGIS.) Some of these discrepancies are due to municipal boundary updates that have not yet been propagated to the Legislative and Congressional District boundaries where appropriate. Some of them are due to errors in one dataset or the other.
Lines in this dataset are not topologically bound to logically-coincident line work published by the State of New Jersey, such as street centerlines, rail ROW centerlines, municipal boundaries.

The Election District feature class includes Election District boundaries for all of the state of New Jersey. However, there are areas that are not covered by an Election District, such a Naval Weapons Station Earle in Monmouth County, and parts of Newark Bay in Hudson County.

Attribute checks revealed the following: 1) There are nine records in Atlantic County with NULL entries for DISTRICT. 2) There are over 2,000 records with duplicate Election District numbers within a municipality. Contra the requirements of NJ Title 19, most of these are due to consecutive numbering within Wards, instead of within the municipality. 3) There are no duplicates in the ELECD_KEY field.

No positional accuracy testing was performed. Most of the data were developed on orthophotography with a nominal scale of 1:2400 or better. In areas without visible man-made features, lines probably less accurate.

enttyp.enttypds: NJ Department of State, Division of Elections; KNOWiNK

attrdomv.udom: Positive integers that are automatically generated and managed by the software.

attr.attrdef: Congressional District identifier for 116th US Congress

attrdomv.udom: Congressional District identifiers from NJ Department of State, Division of Elections web site.

attr.attrdef: Leglslative District identifier for 218th NJ Legislature

attrdomv.udom: NJ Legislative District identifiers from NJ Department of State, Division of Elections web site.

attr.attrdef: County Commissioner District that the Election District falls within.

attrdomv.udom: County Commissioner (fka Freeholder) District number as two-digit text; 00 for no district assignment.

attr.attrdef: Text code intended to be unique and persistent within statewide dataset, constructed from county_code-municipality_code-ward_code-district_code. Maintenance required by KNOWiNK; used by KNOWiNK voter management software to track records.

attrdomv.udom: Unique identifier as text string with four parts separated by dashes.

attr.attrdef: Name of the county, converted to proper case.

codesetd.codesets: NJ Office of GIS, via NJGIN https://njogis-newjersey.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/county-boundaries-of-nj-hosted-3424 (Govt_admin_county_bnd) ; field COUNTY, converted to proper case.

attr.attrdef: Identifier code for municipality, as tracked in the NJ Statewide Voter Registration System (SVRS).

attrdomv.udom: SVRS municipality code: four characters, numbers as text, including leading zeros. For most New Jersey municipalities, this code is the same as the NJ-1040 municipal code, published by the NJ Department of the Treasury (aka: MUNICIPALITY_CODE_NJ-1040, MUN_CODE.) For Monmouth County municipalities, this code is the same as the NJ Department of Community Affairs municipal code (aka: MUNICIPALITY_CODE_DCA, SSN).

attr.attrdef: Municipal identifier code used by the NJ Department of the Treasury, Division of Taxation, for form NJ-1040. The first two characters identify the county, the second two the municipality. This code also is an attribute in GIS municipal boundaries published by NJOGIS (field MUN_CODE.) Added by NJOGIS.
attr.attrdefs: NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS (NJOGIS)

attr.attrdef: Identifier as text for Ward as established by the municipality and the county Board of Elections. Maintenance required by KNOWiNK for use in KNOWiNK software.

attrdomv.udom: Text identifiers, unique by Ward within the municipality; most are two-character numbers as text with leading zeros as necessary, but some are single letters, or geographic directions: e.g. 00, 01, 02 etc; A, B, C etc; North, East, Central, etc.

attr.attrdef: Identifier two-character number as text for Election District, as established by the municipality and the county Board of Elections.

attrdomv.udom: Two-character numbers as text, with leading zeros. Per NJ Title 19 they are supposed to be consecutive and unique within the municipality, but in a large proportion of the municipalities, the numbering is re-started for each Ward. There are nine records for Atlantic County with null values for this attribute.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature boundary in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
